sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
His Maiesties letter, directed to the Lords and Commons of Parliament assembled at Westminster concerning a treaty for peace. With the answer of both Houses thereunto, sent to His Majesty to Oxford, March 9. 1643. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
[2], 6 p.
Printed for Iohn Wright in the Old-Baily, London : March. 13. 1643.
"Die Martis, 12 Mart. 1643. Ordered this day by the Lords in Parliament, that the printer belonging to the House of Peeres shall print His Majesties letter dated the 3 of March ... J. Brown cler. Parliamentorum." In this printing, the caption title begins, "The superscription of the letter was this:"; page 6 contains the names of two signers: Wil. Lord Grey of Wark, Speaker of the House of Peers pro tempore, Wil. Lenthall Speaker of the House of Commons in Parliament. Thomason annotation: "More authentick ... 13 days after." Reproduction of original in: Thomason Collection, British Library.
=======
